Definitions
-----------

-   [**a. Borel function** ]{}

    A function $f_B: (X; \mathcal{B}) \to (X; \mathcal{C}$) of is
    defined to be a *Borel function* if the inverse image of every Borel
    set under $f_B ^{-1}$ is also a Borel set.

-   [**b. Borel groupoid**]{}

    Let ${{\mathbb G}}$ be a groupoid and ${{\mathbb G}}^{(2)}$ a subset
    of ${{\mathbb G}}\times {{\mathbb G}}$– the set of its composable
    pairs. A [*Borel groupoid*]{} is defined as a groupoid
    ${{\mathbb G}}_B$ such that ${{\mathbb G}}_B^{(2)}$ is a Borel set
    in the product structure on
    ${{\mathbb G}}_B \times {{\mathbb G}}_B$, and also with functions
    $ (x,y) \mapsto xy$ from ${{\mathbb G}}_B^{(2)}$ to
    ${{\mathbb G}}_B$, and $ x \mapsto x^{-1}$ from ${{\mathbb G}}_B$ to
    ${{\mathbb G}}_B$ defined such that they are all (ref. [@MRB2k6]).
